definition: to open fire/to shoot a gun

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
gun/firearm/rifle/spear/thing with shape or function similar to a gun/CL:支[zhi1],把[ba3],桿|杆[gan3],條|条[tiao2],枝[zhi1]/to substitute for another person in a test/to knock/classifier for rifle shots

sentences.english: With the gun to Cao Hongyi's head to shoot off the sunspots.
sentences.chinese: 黑子用手枪指着曹弘毅的脑袋，做出要开枪的架势。

sentences.english: Without saying a word, the militiamen shot and killed him.
sentences.chinese: 民兵们二话不说，开枪把他打死了。

sentences.english: He was mowed down by the assassin at point-blank range.
sentences.chinese: 他被暗杀者的近距离开枪打死。

sentences.english: Dong Hongchang was shot down by the black man in prison, Liao Shaoxia was rescued.
sentences.chinese: 董洪昌被黑衣人开枪打倒在监狱中，廖少侠被救出。

sentences.english: The police fired into the air in an attempt to disperse the crowd.
sentences.chinese: 警察朝天开枪，企图驱散人群。

sentences.english: "They shot first and missed, " he commented.
sentences.chinese: 缅军先开枪，未能命中目标。

sentences.english: To fire the gun, just pull the trigger.
sentences.chinese: 开枪只需扣一下扳机就可以了。

sentences.english: A gentleman shoots at you through the window and cripples me.
sentences.chinese: 有一位先生从窗户外面向您开枪，结果倒把我打伤啦。

sentences.english: Authorities have not determined whether the shots were fired southward deliberately or accidentally.
sentences.chinese: 当局还没有确定是否开枪向南故意或意外。

sentences.english: A nasty guy shot her in the back .
sentences.chinese: 一个龌鹾的家伙，从背后开枪打死了他。

sentences.english: As Visser is about to emerge, she fires through the door, and Visser falls.
sentences.chinese: 当维瑟出现时，她隔着门开枪把维瑟打倒。

sentences.english: He shot the guy in his arm and saved Scofield.
sentences.chinese: 他开枪打伤了那个家伙的手臂，挽救了斯科菲尔德。

sentences.english: Stand still there, otherwise I'll shoot.
sentences.chinese: 站在那儿别动，你要动一动我就开枪啦。

sentences.english: He shot the man in self-defense.
sentences.chinese: 他是为了自卫才向那人开枪的。

sentences.english: He misses. The seal dives into his ice hole and is gone.
sentences.chinese: 汤米开枪了，但是没有击中，海豹潜入冰洞中消失了。

definition: to open fire/to shoot a gun
to shoot with a gun/shooting incident
to shoot dead (with a gun, or bow and arrow)
gun/firearm/rifle/spear/thing with shape or function similar to a gun/CL:支[zhi1],把[ba3],桿|杆[gan3],條|条[tiao2],枝[zhi1]/to substitute for another person in a test/to knock/classifier for rifle shots
roof of the mouth/to load (a gun)
